NYC | LA | SF

social_posts.post_text: Yes, Chef! @jeremyallenwhitefinally wears our 618HH Horsehide Perfecto in @gq

The perfect gift for the Dead Head in your life. Our military souvenir jacket is a nod to the trading customs on Shakedown Street before the show, collecting patches and stickers to commemorate the tour. The art depicts the Grateful Dead’s hometown of San Francisco. Check out the reviews “Jacket of a lifetime and my kids will fight over it when I’m gone!” - Jamie. “The embroidery is exquisite…you will not be disappointed.” - Martin. Check out our full collection of official Grateful Dead jackets, sweaters, sweatshirts and accessories in stores and online. #gratefuldead #deadhead #gd #shakedownstreet #thedead #deadheads
Fight the winter chill out there in our flight satin N3-B parka. This sleek coat will keep out the cold and keep you ultra cozy with the softest plush lined hood and pockets.
Still out there searching for gifts? Today is the last day for ground shipping to parts of the continental US! Click the link in our bio for gifts at all price points!

Weekend adventures in our easy to wear waxed cotton mechanics jacket with corduroy, flannel and sherpa details. Don’t forget Tuesday is the last day for 2 day shipping to get all your gifts for the holidays!

We’re still shipping orders for 2 day delivery today (Tuesday) until noon EST, and tomorrow (Wednesday) for overnight delivery until noon EST to arrive before Xmas. Still not sure what to get? Our gift cards are mailed in a handmade leather wallet or sent digitally for an instant gift!

Did you miss the online shipping deadlines for holidays gifts? Stop in to @schottnyc.nycstore, @schottnyc.lastore or @schottnyc.sfstore! We’ll be open until 4pm Christmas Eve and closed on Christmas Day. #shopsmall #shoplocal #buyamerican #madeintheusa #nyc #la #sf

Happy Holidays from our family to yours!! Photo by @bengalbhullar
Home for the holidays and doing a whole lotta nada. The way it should be!
Happy New Year one and all!!

We've been making down filled jackets since the 1960's because they are some of the warmest utilitarian garments you can wear!
One of nature's best forms of insulation, down is durable, compresses for packability, and is easy to move in. Our jackets have a fill power of 700 which means they trap more air and are more insulating, with less weight. They are filled with 80% white duck down and 20% feathers, a quality ratio found in the best technical gear.
Cowhide has such a beautiful natural grain. We use the best quality full grain hides that are tanned to reveal the innate texture of the leather.

Our sherpa lined CPO shirts do double duty as a shirt and a jacket. We use a 20oz plaid wool blend and line it with a soft but thick sherpa pile for added warmth. Our traditional anchor buttons on the cuffs and pockets keep everything in place. Available in hunter plaid (shown here), buffalo plaid, and 3 solid colors.

Thanks @mrmagonline for featuring our 790 officer’s coat on the cover of the February issue! We love @michaelmacko ’s fresh styling of classic pieces like our Jolly Roger sweater and changing our anchor buttons to gold military buttons for a whole new look!
Breaking news from Gobbler’s Knob: Punxsutawney Phil saw his shadow which means 6 more weeks of winter. Bring it on! Photo of @feelingmadcute layered up and ready in his wool Peacoat. #groundhogday .

It’s that time of year where staying in by the fire sounds like a good idea! If you do venture out, naturally insulating materials like wool and down will protect you against these negative temps! Bundle up and stay warm! #polarvortex #arcticairmass
Happy Valentines Day to all the lovers! @denny623 knows the key to doing date night right: flowers and a Perfecto jacket.
Stay warm California!! Stop in to @schottnyc.lastore and @schottnyc.sfstore for all your cold weather gear. @denim_and_whiskey knows how to start a snowy weekend off right.

The world seems to be spinning faster and faster. Anything you can imagine from far away lands, is now just a click away, straight from your pocket and delivered to your door. While things will always change, we revel in doing things the old fashioned way. Often we too will find a shiny new material or method that catapults us into the future. But more often than not, we're using time honored techniques and materials made to stand the test of time.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As global citizens, we know resources are limited and we do our best to use what we have on hand. In a world of fast fashion and disposable clothing, the deadstock wool collection was created as a beacon of timeless quality and craftsmanship. In our New Jersey factory, we hand crafted two of our best selling silhouettes of all time using four universally flattering wools.The peacoat and the shirt collared coach jacket are guaranteed to stand the test of time and transcend fashion trends. Available exclusively online. Order yours today, and bask in the glow of the days when clothing was made to last.

Our varsity jacket and sweater were inspired by the Grateful Dead archivist's personal jacket which he modified while still in high school to represent the school we all wish we'd attended. Check out our official @Gratefuldead collection in stores and online.
Do you listen to podcasts or music in the car? Drop some current favorites in the comments.
World renowned badass, Keanu Reeves wears our black 7810 wool CPO shirt in the March issue of Men’s Journal. #keanureeves #johnwick
Keanu Reeves in our 530 waxy natural pebbled cowhide cafe racer in the March issue of @mensjournal. #madeintheusa #johnwick #keanureeves

In honor of #openingday, here’s a clip from Mets postgame show, Kiner’s Korner. Baseball legend, Ralph Kiner would interview players and his guests would receive one of our jackets! Huge shoutout to the new @kiners_korner who tracked down this video footage from April 2, 1989 and digitized it for us! #kinerskorner #mets #yankees #baseball #mlb

A few years back @feliciathegoat came to us with an idea for a jacket. We met with him in LA and talked fashion and leather. A truly passionate guy who had a clear vision from the very beginning. Fast forward to today and our newest collaboration with @lefleur is available now at golflefleur.com. #madeintheusa #golflefluer #tylerthecreator #callmeifyougetlost #cmiygl

Our official @gratefuldead dancing bears crewneck sweater is 100% cotton, perfect for spring layering. Available in black or blue (shown here) with iconic #GratefulDead symbols dancing through the traditional Fair Isle inspired pattern.
Happy Earth Day! We hope you get outside today on an adventure and enjoy the natural beauty of our home planet.

We believe in creating the best quality products that never have to be replaced. With proper care, our jackets can outlive you, becoming family heirlooms for future generations to fight over. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We stand by our garments and can often repair zippers (seen here), pockets, linings, knit waistbands and cuffs, faux fur collars, ripped seams and snaps to give your USA made jackets more time on your back. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Buying less, and buying products made with natural materials that are a waste product, such as leather, are ways that we can strive to have less impact on the planet. We work with tanneries that are working towards a greener process. Most of our classic styles are made with leather from a tannery using solar power, reducing their water consumption and managing their waste water and solids in environmentally safe ways. Our vegetable tanned leather is made using organic materials in the preservation process. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
For more information on repairs, email us photos at customerservice@schottnyc.com or check out the repairs page on our website. Each is considered on a case by case basis to determine if a repair will improve the jacket. #earthday #leathercare #madeintheusa

Our @schottnyc.sfstore will be closed today due to a power outage in the Jackson Square area. Hopefully we’ll be back in action tomorrow. In the meantime, call us at the factory at 1-800-631-5407 if you need us!
Marlon Brando on the set of The Wild One, 1953.
Happy Mothers Day to all the badass mothers! Thanks for keeping us all in line! Photo of @cc_crivello in her 218w lambskin Perfecto jacket.

This Sunday, May 21st, we’ll be sponsoring @gentlemansride in San Francisco! Join @schottnyc.sfstore at the end to shop our San Francisco store goods and win some prizes! Funds raised by #DGR benefit @movember’s important work with prostate cancer research and men’s mental health. Distinguished Gentleman’s Rides are all over the WORLD this Sunday so if you aren’t in SF, register to ride near you at gentlemansride.com!
Ready for the first holiday weekend of summer! Are you heading out on a road trip or to the beach? Whatever you get into, we hope you kick back and enjoy some much deserved down time!

Today we honor and remember the brave lives lost defending our freedom at home and over seas. We pay respects today and everyday for our veterans and active duty service members. Thank you for your dedication and service.

Our friend @upstateguystyle visited us at our NYC store to chat with one of the earliest members of our sales team, @averjoe. Read their conversation below:

ONE FAVORITE THING WITH JOE PEREZ—

I met Joe Perez (@averjoe) at the @schottnyc store on Elizabeth Street, where he has worked for the past six years. We always had great chats, but never really talked about anything but clothes. When our paths crossed again recently, I told him we should get together and get to know each other a bit. Figuring he’d have a great jacket to talk about, I asked him to help me with a new installment of #onefavoritething. No surprise: it’s a Schott!

Joe is from a Puerto Rican family and hails from the West Bronx. He has a compelling family story, him and his twin brother being raised by their political-activist grandmother. He is passionate about social justice issues, loves to write, and is an avid reader. Towards the end he quoted one of the Stoics and showed me his copy of the “Meditations” of Marcus Aurelius. You can feel his intelligence and wise perspective in his chill demeanor and engaging presence. This guy is clearly a good dude. 

Joe has seven Schott jackets. For this post he picked Schott’s Model 689H in horsehide. “It’s very popular at the store,” he told me. “Four employees out of seven have it. The medium length, 25 inches long, works well. I’ve owned it for seven months now.”

Joe’s look in this jacket shows how important a good fit is with leather.  I think this one fits him perfectly. Paired with a pair of @tecovas cowboy boots (Johnnys in honey suede), boot-cut 517 @levis jeans, and a black Kirkland tee, Joe shows a keen eye for bringing classic pieces together in a fresh way. - @upstateguystyle #onefavoritething
Father’s Day is this Sunday, stop by one of our stores in NYC, LA and SF to find the perfect gift for your old man.

Happy Father’s Day! We hope you’re spending quality time today with the father figures in your life. Four generations of fathers have helped keep our family business alive and kicking for 110 years. Second generation, Mel Schott (with his signature cigar) and his son Michael, pictured here at our factory in the 1970s (if you couldn’t tell by the pants!)
Happy Fourth of July!!! How will you be grilling your steaks at the BBQ today? Comment below! (Secret recipes & techniques welcome!)

The Dead toured for decades because they truly loved the creative artistry of playing live. The thing about live music is each show is ephemeral and one-of-a-kind. Nobody understood this better than the Grateful Dead and their fans, taping each show and trading recordings. In the 80’s and 90’s when a special moment happened at a show, and they really got in the groove, you could only experience it by getting your hands on the tape. These exclusive inside moments are nearly inescapable with viral videos on the internet these days. We gravitate towards individual stories like this, having an experience unlike any other. It’s our goal to make garments that take on your unique shape as you wear it. The individual memories you have while wearing it are ingrained with every scratch and wrinkle. When you look back on the trips you’ve taken with your trusty jacket by your side there’s nothing left to do but smile. #schottnycxgratefuldead click the link in our bio to shop the full collection or visit our stores in San Francisco, Los Angeles or New York. #gratefuldead #deadandco #thefinaltour #sanfrancisco #deadandcosf #sf

If you’re in San Francisco this weekend, be sure to stop by our Jackson Sq store for our official Grateful Dead collection for men and women. @schottnyc.sfstore #Gratefuldead #deadandco #thefinaltour #deadandcosf #thefinaltoursf
Beach or pool? How are you beating the heat this summer? Stay cool out there, #leatherweather will be here before you know it.
Where there’s a will, there’s a way. @__laurelcanyon__ shows us how to handle August.

From Steve McQueen in The Thomas Crown Affair to Chris Evans in Knives Out, the fisherman’s sweater is an enduring classic for a reason. Available in white, moss (shown) and denim, our midweight cable knit sweater will take you from breezy seaside summer nights right on through ski season.

"I have ridden a Harley for 40+ years. I always wear sturdy boots with a good sole for traction when I ride. These boots fit excellently, look great, and are light on the feet. Took them for a 200-mile ride when I got them. In particular, the calf circumference is comfortably wide so I can wear them over my jeans, yet they breathe for comfort in hot weather. Definitely recommend!"- Rocky. Our new 13" harness boots are made of US domestic drum dyed steerhide with a poron foam insole, Vibram sole, Goodyear leather welt and a fiberglass shank. Made in the USA and available in stores and online.
You’ve been asking for this style for years! Our sleek new cowhide leather trench is a versatile addition to your everyday jacket lineup. #madeintheusa #leathertrenchcoat #leather

Today we honor the contributions of the American workers and celebrate our trade and labor unions. We couldn’t make our jackets here in the USA for 110 years without the craftspeople that we consider our extended family. Happy Labor Day!

Itching to break out your jacket now that it’s September, but this sweltering heat is holding you back? Many of you responded to our story about cleaning and conditioning practices for our jackets asking for tips. Jason Schott sat down with Nick at @stridewise to demonstrate how to get your jacket ready for #leatherweather. Click the link in our leather care highlight to watch the full video on Nick’s YouTube.

New York City has been our home for 110 years. This place and it’s people have made us who we are, just as much as we have left our mark here over the years. This city is sewn into the very fabric of our history and of our future. Every single day we are reminded of and inspired by the strength of our neighbors. We will never forget how we all stood together 22 years ago today. We will forever be indebted to the first responders and remember the lives we lost.

New York City, you’ve been our home for 110 years. Beginning in 1913, Irving Schott and his brother Jack peddled the sheepskin lined raincoats door to door that they made in the basement of their Lower East Side shop. Today, we have seen our family’s jackets on the back of some of the most notorious New Yorkers and meet people from all over the world when they come visit us here. Stay tuned here for some very exciting hometown news. #ilovenewyork

Fall jacket weather is fast approaching. Our 24oz wool naval officers coat has hammered metal buttons, a half back belt and a center back vent with hidden button closure. #madeintheusa and available in stores and online.

The first Schott Bros. store at 96 East Broadway in the Lower East Side of New York City. Pictured here in 1933 for an employee outing to Steeplechase Park in Coney Island. Irving Schott and his brother Jack made their sheepskin lined jackets in the basement factory and sold them from the ground floor shop. Irving and Jack are pictured inside in front of the wall of jacket boxes. The last photo is a box for the 333B, one of the earliest models of goatskin Perfecto jackets that was stacked high on those shelves. #newyork #newyorkhistory #nychistory #lowereastside #les

Did you know Irving Schott was the first to put a zipper in a jacket? In the 1920s zippers were just gaining popularity for boots and money belts which were used when pants didn’t have pockets. Buttons were the name of the game. Irving partnered with the Talon Zipper company which was based in Hoboken, New Jersey to add zippers to his leather jackets and the rest is history!

We are excited to announce our New York City flagship store at 32 Howard St is officially open! 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Come in, breathe in the smells of new leather, touch and feel the difference in weight and grain between slick horsehide and buttery pebbled cowhide, experience the weight on your back and the transformative feeling of toughness you get when you wear one of our USA made leather jackets.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We needed some more room to really showcase all our new goods so we moved out of our old home on Elizabeth Street. We can’t wait to meet you here at 32 Howard Street between Broadway and Crosby Street.

Meet us at 32 Howard Street between Broadway and Crosby Street! Our flagship store is officially open with all our newest styles for fall like the 552 pebbled cowhide racer jacket. This easy-wearing, soft and buttery jacket is the perfect casual leather for someone  who likes more freedom of movement from the first wear.
It’s #sweaterweather! Are you team crew neck or cardigan?

In our continued quest to do things the right way, not just the easy way, we are constantly seeking out new ways to reinvent the classics. Sometimes that means trying completely new materials and sometimes that means sourcing vintage materials that are old and rare. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Our newest special edition Perfecto Jacket (Per62) is made to break in the old fashioned way. Have you ever noticed that special patina on old vintage leather jackets? The top crust is worn down to reveal a lighter color underneath? That's because back in the day only the top grain of the leather was tanned. Today we typically use drum dyed cowhide which dyes the hide all the way through. But this time we're throwing it back. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We used a special teacore leather with a smooth ironed finish that gives the leather a smooth grain and a semi-gloss sheen which wears down as the jacket breaks in revealing the lighter tea colored hue underneath the crust.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
To keep it all old school, we used a number 10, two-way front Conmar zipper and vintage inspired Conmar chain pull pocket zippers. In the 1950s and 1960s, Conmar was the number one zipper brand for apparel and workwear in the United States.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The 26 inch length jacket features a 100% cotton yellow and black houndstooth body lining, snap down lapels, collar and shoulder epaulets and a biswing back for extra mobility and ease of movement. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As always, the jacket is hand cut and sewn at our factory in New Jersey on our original turn of the century machines. Find it online or in stores now before it sells out.

Pete Davidson wore our plaid CPO shirt in spruce on @fallontonight last night. This 20oz wool shacket can be worn as a shirt under a jacket or as an outer layer on its own. Available in stores and online in 5 different vintage inspired plaids.

Taking a moment for self reflection outdoors does wonders for the soul. The quiet pace in nature reminds us to slow down and not take anything for granted. 

"Sit in reverie and watch the changing colors of the waves that break upon the idle seashore of the mind."- Longfellow.

🥃 Get ready for a Tiny Tasting and a Big Advent-ure! 

Flaviar is coming to Schott NYC and Schott LA on October 19, promising an unforgettable “teaser” expedition of the new Flaviar 2023 Whiskey Advent Calendar.

Come 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM, unearth some whiskey gems, and get fitted for the holiday whiskey adventure of your life. 🤠
.
.
#TinyTasting #SchottNYCExperience
“Life starts all over again when it gets crisp in the fall.” -F. Scott Fitzgerald.

It starts with a feeling. When you run your fingers across @horweenleather #Chromexcel, you know it's different. A slightly oily, ultra heavyweight hide that breaks in to reveal the most spectacular color variation and creasing as it molds to your unique shape like no other. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The real beauty of Chromexcel is its smell.  Around here we've grown pretty nose blind to that fresh leather jacket smell.  Visitors walk into our factory or stores and take a big inhale wishing they could bottle that scent, but we've mostly grown immune to it. There is an aroma to this leather, however, a mixture of lanolin and tree bark that triggers a dopamine rush to the brain. One whiff and you'll be hooked.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This extra special, smooth whiskey colored pull-up steerhide is tanned using a 4th generation, century old, family recipe in Chicago. As one of the last remaining family tanneries in the US, stepping into their old brick building feels like coming home. Whenever we get our hands on new Horween Chromexcel we try to come up with ways to use their leather that really shines.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This is our first time using one of our classic pant belts in a jacket, for a sleek and modern take on the style. Most of our jackets have a half belt sewn into the side seams and we get a lot of requests for jackets without any belt at all, some have gone as far as to even cut off their belts! 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We use a strong snap under the buckle so it won't swing around if you want to wear the jacket open. The only thing worse than being whacked by a heavy metal buckle is it scratching your gas tank on your bike.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
What's most unique about this one is that it's made from the same leather in 2 different weights. The removable belt is made from raw 8-9oz belt leather and the body is full grain 3.5-4oz garment weight leather. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As always, it's made by hand in our family factory in Union, New Jersey. Click the link in our stories to see more details of the P677.
Our limited release heirlooms-in-the-making drops tomorrow. Stay tuned…
Spooky season is upon us, what’s your favorite scary movie?

From Marlon Brando to James Dean, @schottnyc has outfitted some true icons. We feel very fortunate to have had an opportunity to work with these legends of leather to design our own Bespoke Post limited release jacket— a roughout leather rancher fully made in America, and built to last a lifetime. Cop one while we got 'em.

Have you come by to see our new New York City flagship store yet? We can’t wait to meet you here at 32 Howard Street between Broadway and Crosby Street in SoHo. We are open Monday- Saturday 11am-7pm and Sunday 12pm-6pm.
The origin story behind our latest collab—a roughout leather rancher jacket built to embrace your adventures, and age with grace.
Happy Halloween!

Please join us to celebrate the work of fine artist @eleanor.voorhees on display and for sale for a limited time at our new NYC flagship store. 

Thursday, November 9, 6-9pm 
Schott NYC 32 Howard Street New York, NY 10013.
RSVP and 21+ required to attend: rsvp@schottnyc.com

Experiencing Eleanor's art in person is truly transformative. The textures and found objects transport you to the time and place and where you feel the grittiness and eclectic authenticity of New York City.

"My work has evolved beyond oil paintings on canvas featuring the cityscapes of New York City to also embrace the three dimensional and textured medium of mixed media. My latest sculptural mixed media paintings are the result of true experimentation. I build the cityscapes out of found objects such as wire, jewelry, wood, fabric and more and then they’re entirely painted in oils."- Eleanor Voorhees.

Eleanor Voorhees has been working and selling her original oil and mixed media paintings since 2012 from her permanent open studio on the 3rd floor of The People’s Store at 28 N Union Street in Lambertville, New Jersey, she has shown her paintings, wearable art apparel and a small selection of vintage home furnishings.

The first photo is her newest work using found objects from our factory to create a unique expression of our new storefront. The 2nd and 3rd photos are of her process and materials used in making it. The 4th is a completed mixed media and 5th is that piece in progress and lastly, the 6th is an oil painting on canvas all displayed at the store and available for sale with 9 other works.

Looking for a one-and-done leather jacket? Our 552 pebbled cowhide racer is one of our most popular new styles of the season. It’s buttery soft and easy to wear from the moment you take it home. From coast to coast, whatever your style or climate, it looks great with everything in your closet. No brainer! Snag one before they’re gone.

There are many times in life when we endure with discipline and patience, for the sweet rewards of delayed gratification. This isn't one of them. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We've teamed up with one of the highest regarded leather tanneries in the world for our new limited edition horsehide cafe racer jacket (P641H). Shinki-Hikaku, based in Kobe, Japan, has been creating specialty horsehide since 1951 with a unique process that can take months. The leather has a rare texture and grain unlike the slick, shiny, stiff horsehide you're used to seeing from us.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Imagine for a moment, the tingly sensation you get when running your hands through sculpting clay. The finishing process makes this leather feel soft and malleable from the moment you try it on. The combination of oils and waxes in the leather allow it to hold its own shape while being ready to mold to your body. From the first wear, it feels like it's already broken in.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We used Conmar zippers with a 2-way front zipper for added comfort while sitting. The P641H jacket is lined with a 10.5oz black and white houndstooth wool. As always, it's handmade in the USA and available in stores and online now.

Today we honor our veterans and active duty military. Thank you for your service and keeping us safe at home and abroad. We offer a military discount all year long, contact our customer service team for more details.

The legend of Jawn Burgundy: With fruit forward, earthy notes and a deep reddish-brown profile, burgundy is a sophisticated hue that conjures feelings of refined royalty. The sumptuous shade provides a warm alternative to brown and pairs well with dark indigo and black, surely staples in any closet. Try mixing burgundy into your daily uniform with a flannel, wool CPO shirt or our new pullup cowhide leather delivery jacket. Slip into one of our warm cozy sweaters and be transported to an apartment with many leather-bound books that smells of rich mahogany.

Our eighth - and, in our opinion, best - collaboration with @schottnyc launches this upcoming Monday 11/20 in celebration of our 20th anniversary. Read more about the release via the link in our bio. 

📷: @vinnypicone 
👤: @tlmtri

Looking to catch some deals this holiday season? The only place you’ll find them is by joining our mailing list on our website. Get on the list today before you miss some big announcements later this week!

Our stores and factory will be closed tomorrow for Thanksgiving so we can spend some quality time with family and friends. Our stores in NYC, LA and SF are open regular hours this weekend. Stop by to find exclusive holiday weekend specials in store and join our mailing list on our website for Cyber Monday online news.

Happy Thanksgiving from our family to yours! We are thankful for all our employees, customers, retailers and international partners for helping our family business have another wonderful year! Our factory and stores are closed today so we can spend time with our families and friends. We hope you enjoy a great feast with your loved ones too! (This jacket is style 619 and available for preorder online.)

Today is #smallbusinesssaturday and we encourage you to explore the local brick and mortar stores in your community. We are so grateful for our incredible small business retail partners who bring our products to your neighborhood and care so much for their customers. We believe there is no more satisfying of a shopping experience than walking into a special small business, trying on a jacket for the first time, having an expert help you find the perfect fit and walking out with a big heavy bag. Find an authorized retailer near you with the store locator on our website.

If you know how we do things around here, you know that we respect time honored materials and authentic manufacturing techniques. Deep down to our core, we wholeheartedly believe that nothing looks better with our jackets than a perfectly broken-in pair of blue jeans. This is why we are introducing our first pair of USA made, 100% indigo dyed denim jeans. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Just like your leather jacket, indigo dyed fabrics break in as you wear them. A pair of raw indigo dyed denim is like a blank canvas: Whatever you put in your pockets, and however you move about your day will become the distinct markings on your jeans. These are truly a one-of-a-kind, personal artifact, a woven tapestry that narrates the tale of how you live.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We are using a revered Japanese denim woven on 100 year old shuttle looms at the Nihon Menpu mill. Due to their perfectionism, each antique loom can only generate approximately 98.5 ft to 100 ft of fabric each day which equates to roughly 10 pairs of jeans. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The denim is a rich, deep midnight blue color rarely found in indigo denim these days. The number of times their yarn gets dipped in the 100% indigo during the dying process is a family secret passed down through a family business for over 100 years, just how we do things at home. Speaking of home, the jeans are cut and sewn right here in New Jersey. #denim #madeintheusa #americanmade #selvedge #selvedgedenim #japanesedenim #rawdenim #indigodenim #jeans #bluejeans

The smell, the feel, the touch, the warm embrace of a leather jacket. Unleash the true essence of leather with our meticulously crafted jackets. Elevate your style, embrace your journey, and be part of the legacy. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Just a reminder: this Friday 12/15 is the last day for guaranteed ground shipping in the US before Xmas.

For our new “D- pocket” motorcycle jacket, we are using leather from one of the highest regarded tanneries in the world. Shinki-Hikaku, based in Kobe, Japan, has been creating specialty horsehide since 1951 with a unique process that can take months. The 3oz teacore leather has a rare texture and grain with a supple hand feel. As the jacket breaks in, the black crust will wear away revealing a lighter colored core. This is how jackets used to be tanned back in the day which is why you see so much color variation in vintage jackets. 
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
The finishing process makes this leather feel soft and malleable from the moment you try it on. The combination of oils and waxes in the leather allow it to hold its own shape while being ready to mold to your body. From the first wear, it feels like it’s already broken in.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
This leather speaks for itself so we kept the details intentional. Mixing design elements from several styles in our vintage archives, we combined our original Perfecto motorcycle jacket’s “D-pocket” with a down pointed yoke, an inverted pleat and a fixed half belt at the waist. This biker jacket is slim and sleek without our signature belt or epaulets and features hidden snaps behind the lapels for a more minimalist look.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
We used Conmar zippers on the 4 chest pockets and added a 2-way front zipper for added comfort while sitting. In the 1950s and 1960s, Conmar was the number one zipper brand for apparel and workwear in the United States. The jacket is lined with a 100% Cotton flannel and features button cuffs at the wrist.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
As always, it’s handmade in the USA and available in stores and online now.
